messages.text: Yes. Bridge is up, message received. The chat loop is working end-to-end — your message hit port 3456, MCP server queued it, I popped it with hw_await_message. Type anything else to keep testing.
so you will respond when i type in here without havng to type in the terminal too?

Not automatically — you still need to trigger me in the terminal to call hw_await_message. The bridge stores your message, but I don't poll continuously on my own.

To make it truly seamless (type in app → I respond without terminal input), we'd need a persistent loop running in the MCP server that watches for messages and fires responses. That's buildable. Want me to add that?
Hey — I'm here. No API cost, just your Claude Max session. Type anything in the app and I'll respond. This is the loop.
Got both messages. Watcher detected them but the SendKeys ping failed — AppActivate('Windows Terminal') isn't targeting the right window. Fixing now.
Hey — loop is running. SendKeys is dead (no visible window to target), but this works. I poll every 30s. You type → I get it within 30s max. Type something else to test the speed.
Ha — what specifically? The session-start hook loading context? The Pokkit training? Something else?
the hello world app. i'm talking to you via the built in chat!

Oh that's wild — yeah, the `hw_await_message` / `hw_send_response` MCP tools are fully wired up. You're literally messaging me through the app itself right now.

What does it look like on your end? And what's the Hello World app — is this something you built, or a template/starter?
you don't have memory of the app?
